basics.headline: Vice President of IT Operations
basics.name: Bill Palmer
basics.summary: IT operations leader charged with stabilizing business-critical systems and rescuing the Phoenix ERP program. Pragmatic, business-first problem solver who builds trust, flow, and collaboration across Development, Operations, and Security.

organization.name: Parts Unlimited
organization.description: A national retail and e-commerce company undergoing major IT modernization.

employments.summary: Promoted to lead IT Operations with a mandate to restore service reliability, align IT delivery to business outcomes, and turn around the Phoenix Project.
highlights: Restored stability of revenue-impacting systems within first 90 days
Established cross-functional change advisory process to reduce failed changes
Reduced mean time to recovery (MTTR) by introducing blameless postmortems
Partnered with Development and Security to implement a CI/CD pipeline for core services

references.name: Steve Masters
references.testimonial: Bill brought calm leadership and business alignment to our most critical technology initiatives. The turnaround of Phoenix was pivotal.

organization.name: Parts Unlimited
organization.description: A national retail and e-commerce company.

employments.summary: Led the team responsible for order processing, inventory, and fulfillment platforms on midrange systems.
highlights: Achieved 99.9% availability for order management systems
Introduced capacity planning that prevented peak-season outages
Implemented proactive monitoring with clear SLOs and escalation paths

initiatives.summary: Cross-functional transformation program to increase deployment frequency, improve stability, and accelerate feedback loops across Development, Operations, and Security.
highlights: Increased deployment frequency from monthly to weekly for core services
Cut change failure rate by 40% through peer reviews and automated testing
Introduced value stream mapping workshops to identify and remove bottlenecks
initiatives.name: Phoenix Project DevOps Transformation

references.name: Erik Reid
references.testimonial: Bill embraced the Three Ways—flow, feedback, and continual learning—and institutionalized them.

issuer.name: AXELOS
issuer.description: Global best practice owner for ITIL.

certificates.name: ITIL Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management
certificates.summary: Validated knowledge of ITIL concepts for incident, problem, and change management.

publications.name: From Firefighting to Flow: Lessons from the Phoenix Project
publications.summary: A practical account of stabilizing critical systems and implementing DevOps practices to improve throughput and reliability.

interests.name: Lean Management
interests.summary: Applying Lean principles and the Three Ways to tech operations.
